name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
At 10 p.m. on June 3, 1989, CCTV broadcast an emergency notice from the martial law command, asking Beijing residents to stay at home and not go to Tiananmen Square.
At the same time, the first gunshots rang out near Wukesong.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
On July 9, 1989, people in Leipzig, East Germany, used the Chinese word "Democracy" to express their solidarity with the June 4th Incident and the Chinese people. Three months later, on October 9, the scale of the peaceful protest in Leipzig reached 70,000 people.
Less than a month later, the Berlin Wall fell.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
As the 35th anniversary of June 4th approaches, we collaborate with Human Rights in China @hrichina and Humanitarian China @HChina89 to release a series of special photos of June 4th. Scenes of the 1989 Democracy Movement No. 23 (June 4)
[June 4th, the darkest night in Beijing] [In this white dawn, I hold my dead classmate]
The general process of what happened that night is as follows:
Â·

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
@hrichina @HChina89 One of the scenes on June 4:
1. A large number of tanks entered Tiananmen Square. Citizens refused to leave to protect the students and confronted the tanks.
2. Citizens fled at the critical moment of life and death.
3. After occupying Tiananmen Square, the martial law troops set a huge fire at night.
4. A group of soldiers in front of the Great Hall of the People pressed towards the gathered students with guns

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Graffiti commemorating the 35th anniversary of June 4th in Downtown Los Angeles
The left one is designed by friends from the Hong Kong community, depicting the surveillance and infringement of freedom in the future of Hong Kong; the right one is designed by friends from the Chinese community, depicting breaking through the blockade and surveillance and rediscovering the Tank Man.
The specific address of the graffiti is here: 1740 Santee St, Los Angeles, CA 90015

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Scene 5 of the June 4th Incident:
1. A student was covered in blood, and it was unknown whether he was dead or alive.
2. Citizens used flatbed trucks to rescue the injured.
3. Citizens could no longer tolerate it and fought back with bricks
4. Military vehicles burned by citizens on Chang'an Avenue

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: On the evening of June 4, in Hong Kong, police stopped a woman who turned on her phone's flashlight and asked her where she was going. The woman responded that she was going to Causeway Bay to eat ramen.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: The Nanjing Yangtze River Bridge was the main activity site for Nanjing students during the June 4th Incident. On June 7 of that year, more than 400 Nanjing college students blocked the Nanjing Yangtze River Bridge with four buses until the evening. The next day, they continued to sit on the bridge to express their dissatisfaction.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: According to Hong Kong independent media reports, the young man was arrested because he was carrying a copy of "Xi Jinping: The Governance of China".

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
On June 4, the British Embassy in China posted a short video on Weibo to commemorate the 35th anniversary of June 4, showing the process of a People's Daily "from June 4 to a blank sheet of paper". 
Ten minutes later, the Weibo post was blocked.
